FuncDef:
The evpn-route-origin igp command enables the origin-igp function for EVPN routes.
The undo evpn-route-origin igp command disables the origin-igp function for EVPN routes. The evpn-route-origin igp command enables the origin-igp function for EVPN routes. The undo evpn-route-origin igp command disables the origin-igp function for EVPN routes. By default, the origin-igp function is enabled for EVPN routes, and the origin attribute carried by generated EVPN routes is igp. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
Examples: Warning: This operation will delete and then re-originate all ES, AD, and inclusive routes. Continue? [Y/N]:y
